title: What studies are currently accepting new patients?
definition:
At the moment, we have studies for Diabetes, Diabetic Complications, High cholesterol, Heart Health, Ulcerative Colitis, Crohn's disease, Irritable Bowel Syndrome or IBS, Osteoarthritis, Rheumatoid Arthritis or RA, Major Depressive Disorder requiring medication, Migraines, Eczema, Heartburn, Lupus, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Chronic Cough, and Overactive Bladder.
We also have studies for a women's health condition, Endometriosis; and a men's health hypogonadism (which is low testosterone) study.

title: Who qualifies for these clinical studies?
definition: Men and women over the age of 18. Depending on your answers to the questionnaire, we’ll tell you if you qualify for a study.

title: Where are the clinical sites?
definition: There are centers throughout the United States that are helping to conduct this study.

title: When will I know if I qualify for a study?
definition: If you pass this initial screener, a member of a study doctor’s staff will contact you—they will ask you more questions to further assess if you should participate in this study. If they believe that you should be considered, you will be asked to schedule an appointment at the doctor’s office (or clinic) for further evaluations. When you go to the doctor’s office, the study doctor and his/her team conduct study related examinations and tests to see if you can be enrolled into this study.

title: How long will my participation in the study last, if I qualify?
definition: Participation depends on the study you qualify for, and may last for a few months up to approximately one year. During this time, the study doctors will monitor your health and progress.

title: What is the purpose of these clinical studies?
definition: The purpose of these studies is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of investigational medications.

title: Does my doctor have to give his/her permission?
definition: No, but you may contact your personal physician or you may give the study doctor permission to contact your personal physician.

title: Why are you recording this call?
definition: The call is being recorded for quality assurance purposes. Also, if you are a resident of California, the California civil code 1798.91 requires a recording of the entire conversation whenever a business requests medical information directly from an individual for direct marketing purposes. California law also requires us to keep the recording for two years after the conversation date. The audio recording will be kept in a secure location and will not be shared without your permission except if required by law.

title: How did Acurian get my name?
definition: Acurian may have received your name in one of the following ways: you may have provided it on the Acurian website or during a previous clinical trial screening; you could have also provided it if you completed a survey through a magazine, mail, online, or elsewhere. If you provided your name in one of these ways, you also indicated an interest in receiving information about health-related issues. Occasionally, Acurian uses publicly available information based on things like location, age and gender. To reassure you, Acurian did not receive your information from your doctor or any other health professional, and your confidentiality has not been compromised in any way. You may visit www.acurianhealth.com to view our privacy policy.

title: Abdominal aortic aneurysm
definition: An enlarged area in the lower part of the aorta, the major blood vessel in the stomach that supplies blood to the body.

title: Actinic or solar keratosis
definition: A crusty or scaly skin growth caused by exposure to the sun or artificial sources of UV light. It is considered a precancer because if left alone, it could develop into skin cancer.

title: Alcoholic liver disease
definition: Damage to the liver and its function after years of heavy drinking. Alcoholic liver disease has four main stages: alcoholic fatty liver disease, alcoholic hepatitis, fibrosis, and cirrhosis.

title: Alzheimer’s Disease
definition: A progressive disease that destroys memory and other important mental functions.

title: Amputation (am·pu·ta·shun)
definition: Amputation is the loss of a body part -- usually a finger, toe, arm, or leg -- that may occur as the result of a planned surgery or (more rarely) an accident or injury.

title: Anemia
definition: Anemia is sometimes called low iron. It happens when the blood doesn't have enough red blood cells to carry oxygen through the body. People with anemia may feel tired, have pale skin, cold hands and feet, shortness of breath, or trouble concentrating.

title: Aneurysm Clip
definition: A metal clip, like a tiny clothespin, that is implanted by surgery and clamps off part of an aneurysm to prevent it from bleeding.

title: Angina (chest pain)
definition: Chest discomfort caused by poor blood flow through the blood vessels (coronary vessels) of the heart muscle (myocardium).

title: Angioplasty
definition: During an angioplasty procedure, doctors use a catheter to place a balloon in a blood vessel/artery that has become narrowed and is reducing blood flow to the heart. The balloon is inflated and used to widen the blood vessel/artery.

title: Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS)
definition: A long-term disease that causes inflammation of the joints between the spinal bones, and the joints between the spine and pelvis. It eventually causes the affected spinal bones to join together. Signs of the disease are visible on x-ray or MRI, so your doctor may call this Radiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis.

title: Anorexia
definition: Anorexia is an eating disorder characterized by an excessive fear of gaining weight, that can result in extreme dieting or self-starvation.

title: Antisocial personality disorder
definition: A mental condition in which a person consistently shows no regard for right and wrong and ignores the rights and feelings of others. People with antisocial personality disorder tend to antagonize, manipulate or treat others harshly or with indifference. They show no guilt or remorse for their behavior, and often violate the law, lie, behave violently or impulsively, or have problems with drug and alcohol use.

title: Anxiety or Anxiety disorder
definition: A mental health disorder characterized by feelings of worry, dread, uneasiness, or fear that are strong enough to interfere with one's daily activities.

title: APAP
definition: Automatic titrating (measuring and adjusting) continuous Positive Airway Pressure. Similar to a CPAP machine, but it allows a pressure range to be set rather than a single continuous air pressure.

title: Arthritis
definition: A condition causing painful inflammation and stiffness of the joints.

title: Asperger Syndrome
definition: Asperger syndrome is an autism spectrum disorder considered to be on the "high functioning" end of the spectrum. Children and adults with Asperger have difficulty with social interactions. Unlike autism, Asperger does not cause significant delays or difficulties with language or cognitive development.

title: Asthma
definition: Asthma is a chronic disease that can affect children and adults, which causes the airways to become sore and swollen. This can cause wheezing, coughing, chest tightness and trouble breathing, especially early in the morning or at night.

title: Atherectomy
definition: Plaque "shaving" to remove build-up of plaque from blood vessels.

title: Atherosclerotic Vascular Disease or Atherosclerosis
definition: Narrowed or hardened blood vessels in the heart or brain; also called "hardening of the arteries."

title: Atopic dermatitis
definition: Atopic Dermatitis, also known as Eczema, is a chronic skin condition characterized by swelling, redness, itching and flaking of the skin.

title: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, ADHD or ADD
definition: ADHD is a chronic condition that affects children and often persists into adulthood. ADHD includes a combination of problems, such as difficulty focusing, over-activity, and impulsive behavior.

title: Atrial Fibrillation or Afib
definition: An abnormal and often rapid heartbeat that causes poor blood flow to the body. Symptoms may include heart palpitations, fainting, shortness of breath, chest pain, and weakness.

title: Autism
definition: Autism is part of a spectrum of developmental disorders that affect the brain. Autism typically appears in a child's first 3 years of life. Symptoms of autism include trouble with social interaction, verbal and nonverbal communication problems, and repetitive behaviors. The term "spectrum" refers to the wide range of symptoms, skills, and levels of disability that can occur in people with autism.

title: Autoimmune hepatitis
definition: A disease in which the body's immune system attacks the liver, causing inflammation and damage.

title: Axial Spondyloarthritis (axSpA)
definition: A relatively new name for a long-term disease that causes inflammation of the joints between the spinal bones, and the joints between the spine and pelvis. It may take years for signs of the disease to be visible on x-ray or MRI. When signs are NOT visible, your doctor calls this Non-radiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis. When signs are visible, your doctor may call this Radiographic Axial Spondyloarthritis, or the older term, Ankylosing Spondylitis.

title: Bariatric surgery
definition: Bariatric surgery, also called weight loss surgery, alters the digestive system to help people with severe weight-related health problems lose weight.

title: BCG or Bacillus Calmette-Guerin vaccine
definition: BCG, or Bacillus Calmette-Guerin, is a vaccine for tuberculosis. Many foreign-born persons have been BCG-vaccinated. BCG is used in many countries with a high prevalence of TB to prevent childhood tuberculous meningitis.

title: Binge Eating
definition: Binge-eating is a serious eating disorder in which someone eats unusually large amounts of food. Almost everyone overeats on occasion, such as having seconds or thirds of a holiday meal. But for some people, overeating crosses the line to binge-eating and it becomes a regular occurrence, usually done in secret.

title: BiPAP
definition: Bilevel (two level) Positive Airway Pressure. Similar to a CPAP machine, but it delivers both an inhale pressure and an exhale pressure.

title: Bipolar Disorder
definition: Bipolar disorder is a condition in which people go back and forth between periods of a very good or irritable mood and depression. The "mood swings" between mania and depression can be very quick.

title: Blocked Arteries
definition: Arteries become blocked when a substance called plaque builds up and blocks blood flow. Blocked arteries increase the risk of heart attack, stroke and death.

title: Blood transfusion (blood trans·fu·shun)
definition: Receiving whole blood or parts of blood such as, red blood cells, platelets or plasma.

title: Borderline personality disorder
definition: A mental disorder marked by a pattern of ongoing instability in moods, behavior, self-image, and functioning. People with this disorder often behave impulsively, react strongly to perceived abandonment, and engage in idealization and devaluation of others, alternating between high positive regard for people and great disappointment in them.

title: Bowel Obstruction
definition: A bowel obstruction happens when either the small or large intestine is partially or completely blocked. The blockage prevents food, fluids, and gas from moving through the intestines in the normal way. The blockage may cause severe pain that comes and goes.

title: Bowel Stricture
definition: A bowel stricture, also known as an intestinal stricture, is when scarring of the bowel leads to narrowing. Symptoms of a bowel stricture include abdominal pain, cramping and bloating.

title: Bulimia
definition: Bulimia is an eating disorder characterized by an excessive fear of gaining weight, which can result in a pattern of "binging and purging" -- eating large quantities of food followed by vomiting, using laxatives, and/or exercising excessively.

title: Bronchiectasis
definition: Destruction and widening of the large airways. It can be caused by infection, inhaling an object or food particles, or by other conditions such as cystic fibrosis.

title: Capsule endoscopy
definition: A procedure that uses a tiny wireless camera, which sits inside a vitamin-size capsule, to take pictures of your digestive tract

title: Carpal tunnel syndrome
definition: A condition that causes numbness, tingling, or weakness in the fingers, hand, or wrist -- caused by a compressed nerve in the carpal tunnel, a narrow passageway on the palm side of your wrist.

title: Catheterization
definition: This is a procedure done to diagnose and treat heart-related conditions. A long thin tube called a catheter is inserted in an artery or vein in your groin, neck, or arm and threaded through your blood vessels to your heart.

title: Celiac disease (see·lee·ack dih·zeez)
definition: A reaction to foods containing gluten, in which your immune system responds by damaging the small intestine.

title: Cellulite
definition: A dimpled or lumpy appearance of the skin, often on hips, thighs, and buttocks. Normal fat beneath the skin pushes against connective tissue, causing the skin above to pucker.

title: Cervical polyps
definition: Growths that usually appear on the cervix where it opens into the vagina. They vary in size and often look like bulbs on thin stems. Cervical polyps are usually not cancerous (benign) and can occur alone or in groups.

title: Chronic cough
definition: A cough that lasts eight weeks or longer. Many underlying conditions can cause chronic cough, such as tobacco use, postnasal drip, asthma, and acid reflux.

title: Chronic kidney failure
definition: Loss of kidney function over time, until the kidneys can no longer filter waste and excess fluid from the blood.

title: Circadian rhythm sleep disorder
definition: A disruption of the natural sleep-wake rhythm. People with these disorders usually have insomnia at certain times and excessive sleepiness at other times of the day. Common circadian rhythm disorders include Advanced Sleep Phase Disorder, Delayed Sleep Phase Disorder, Shift Work Disorder, and Narcolepsy.

title: Cirrhosis
definition: Cirrhosis is a condition that causes irreversible scarring of the liver. As scar tissue replaces normal tissue, blood flow through your liver is affected, making it increasingly difficult for your liver to carry out functions that are essential for life and health.

title: Chronic Bronchitis
definition: Chronic bronchitis is a long-term inflammation of your bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from your lungs. Chronic bronchitis is one of the conditions included in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease or COPD.

title: Cluster headache
definition: Cluster headaches occur in attacks or groups, usually with remission periods in between when the headaches stop completely. They are severe headaches on one side of the head, usually causing pain in or around the eye. The eye may water, swell, or become red, and your nose may be runny or stuffy on the same side.

title: Episodic cluster headache
definition: The most common type of cluster headache, with distinct attack and remission phases. You may experience headache attacks for a week or more once a year, often reoccuring around the same time or season the following year. Pain-free periods last one month or longer.

title: Chronic cluster headache
definition: A rarer type of cluster headache, in which headache attacks occur for more than one year without remission, or with remission (pain-free) periods lasting less than one month.

title: Cochlear implant
definition: A small electronic device that is surgically implanted to help you hear better, if you are deaf or very hard-of-hearing.

title: COPD
definition: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is one of the most common lung diseases. People with COPD have difficulty expelling air from the lungs. COPD makes it hard to breathe and causes shortness of breath and coughing. There are two main forms of COPD:
subDefinition: Most people with COPD have a combination of both conditions.

title: Cystic Fibrosis
definition: A life-threatening disease passed down through families that causes thick, sticky mucus to build up in the lungs, digestive tract, and other areas of the body. It is one of the most common chronic lung diseases in children and young adults.

title: Cancer
definition: Any malignant growth or tumor caused by abnormal and uncontrolled cell division; it may spread to other parts of the body through the lymphatic system or the blood stream.

title: Crohn's disease (cronhz dih·zeez)
definition: Inflammation of the digestive system. It often affects the lower part of the small intestine, but can also affect any area of the digestive tract from the mouth to the anus. Symptoms include strong abdominal cramps, bloody diarrhea, fever, unusual gas and even weight loss which may come and go.

title: Colonoscopy
definition: A test that allows your doctor to look at the inner lining of your large intestine (rectum and colon), using a thin, flexible tube with a light and tiny camera at the tip.

title: Colostomy
definition: A surgical procedure that connects the colon to the surface of the abdomen, creating an opening called a stoma. Waste material leaves the body through the stoma and collects in a colostomy bag.

title: Congestive heart failure or CHF
definition: Heart failure simply means that the heart is not pumping blood through the body as well as it should. As the heart's pumping action weakens, blood backs up into the blood vessels around the lungs and causes seepage into the lungs. The fluid causes congestion and makes it hard to breathe. Many people with heart failure also have swollen legs and feet. That is why heart failure is sometimes called congestive heart failure.

title: Constipation
definition: A condition in which bowel movements are infrequent or hard to pass. Severe constipation may cause fecal impaction, which can obstruct the bowel and become life-threatening.

title: Coronary Artery Bypass Graft (CABG or "cabbage")
definition: The arteries that supply blood and oxygen to the heart muscle become hardened and narrowed. A bypass of the blocked arteries by a blood vessel graft is performed, using blood vessels taken from the leg or another part of the body.

title: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) or Coronary Heart Disease (CHD)
definition: Narrowing of the small blood vessels that supply blood and oxygen to the heart.

title: Coronary Artery Procedures
definition: Any procedures which are performed to restore the supply of blood and oxygen to the heart muscle when the surrounding arteries become hardened and narrowed. This includes procedures that can be performed using a cardiac catheter, such as stent placement, as well as more invasive procedures such as coronary artery bypass grafting (also known as CABG or "cabbage").

title: Carotid artery disease (ka·rah·tid ar·ter·y dih·zeez)
definition: The arteries in your neck become narrow, usually because of atherosclerosis. This is the build-up of cholesterol and other material in an artery.

title: Carotid Endarterectomy
definition: Surgery to remove plaque from blood vessels in the neck.

title: Cholesterol Level
definition: Measurement of the amount of cholesterol in the blood, measured as milligrams per deciliter.

title: CPAP
definition: Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) is the leading therapy for sleep apnea. Patients wear a face or nasal mask during sleep. The mask, connected to a pump, provides a positive flow of air into the nasal passages in order to keep the airway open.

title: Dementia
definition: Loss of brain function that occurs with certain diseases. It affects memory, reasoning, language, judgment, and behavior.

title: Dense Breasts
definition: Breasts that contain less fatty tissue, and more fibrous or glandular tissue. This may make it more difficult to detect breast cancer on a mammogram because the cancer can blend in with the normal tissue.

title: Depression
definition: A mood disorder that causes symptoms such as low energy, prolonged sadness or irritability, and lack of interest in daily activities. It can be triggered by a chemical imbalance or stressful, emotional situations.

title: Depression (current episode)
definition: Episodes of depression can come and go. A current episode of depression is a period of time when symptoms of depression are present.

title: Diabetes
definition: Diabetes is a chronic condition that occurs when the body cannot produce enough insulin or cannot effectively use insulin, causing elevated blood sugar.

title: Diabetic Ketoacidosis (DKA)
definition: Diabetic ketoacidosis, or DKA, is a serious problem that affects people with diabetes.  It happens when the body cannot use the sugar called glucose as a fuel source because there is not enough insulin. Fat is used for fuel instead. When fat breaks down, waste products called ketones build up in the body.

title: Diabetic Foot Ulcers (Non-healing Ulcers)
definition: Diabetic foot ulcers are open sores or wounds on the feet that can occur in people with diabetes. Left untreated, foot ulcers can run the risk of developing an infection, which could become severe.

title: Diabetic Gastroparesis
definition: A disorder affecting people with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes in which the stomach takes too long to empty its contents (delayed gastric emptying).

title: Diabetic Nephropathy (di·e·bet·ik ni·frop·a·thy)
definition: Kidney disease (damage to the cells of the kidney) as a complication of diabetes.

title: Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
definition: Nerve disorder caused by diabetes, which leads to numbness, loss of sensation, and sometimes pain in your feet, legs, or hands.

title: Dialysis (Kidney Dialysis)
definition: A treatment in which a machine filters wastes, salts, and fluid from your blood when your kidneys are no longer healthy enough to do this work.

title: Double balloon endoscopy
definition: ‘Push-and-pull’ endoscopic technique to easily see the small bowel in real time with the use of balloons fitted over a special camera and the endoscope.

title: Dust or house dust mite allergy
definition: House dust mite allergy is an allergic reaction to tiny bugs that commonly live in house dust. Signs of dust mite allergy include sneezing and runny nose. Many people with dust mite allergy also experience signs of asthma, such as wheezing and difficulty breathing.

title: Eczema
definition: Eczema, also known as Atopic Dermatitis, is a chronic skin condition characterized by skin itching, redness, swelling, and flaking.

title: Electromyography (EMG)
definition: A procedure to assess the health of muscles and the nerve cells that control them (motor neurons). Motor neurons transmit electrical signals that cause muscles to contract. An EMG translates these signals into graphs, sounds, or numerical values that a specialist interprets.

title: Emphysema
definition: Emphysema occurs when the air sacs in your lungs are gradually destroyed, making you progressively more short of breath. Emphysema is one of several diseases known collectively as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, or COPD. Smoking is the leading cause of emphysema.

title: Endometrioma
definition: A type of cyst caused by endometriosis, formed when a tiny patch of endometrial tissue (the tissue that normally lines the uterine wall) grows inside the ovary. Because the endometrial tissue inside the cyst responds to monthly hormones, it bleeds and fills the interior of the cyst with blood. Since older blood appears brown, this is the origin of the term "chocolate cyst."

title: Endometriosis
definition: A disorder in which tissue that normally lines the uterus grows outside of the uterus. The main symptoms are pelvic pain and infertility.

title: End stage renal disease (ESRD)
definition: The last stage of chronic kidney disease. When you reach this stage, your kidneys no longer work well enough for you to survive without dialysis or a kidney transplant.

title: Enlarged prostate
definition: Benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), commonly called prostate enlargement, is a common condition as men get older. When the prostate gland becomes enlarged, it can press on the urethra, causing urinary symptoms. Untreated prostate gland enlargement can block the flow of urine out of the bladder and can cause bladder, urinary tract, or kidney problems.

title: Erectile dysfunction
definition: Inability to develop or maintain an erection of the penis during sexual activity. Causes may include aging, cardiovascular disease, diabetes, neurological problems, hormonal insufficiencies, or drug side effects.

title: Fatty liver disease
definition: Increased buildup of fat in the liver; may be associated with alcohol consumption, but can also be present in people who drink little or no alcohol. Most people with fatty liver disease have no symptoms, but some may experience fatigue, weight loss, and abdominal pain.

title: Fibromyalgia
definition: A common syndrome in which people experience long-term, body-wide pain and tender points in joints, muscles, tendons, and other soft tissues.

title: Flare-up
definition: People with COPD often experience a flare-up of symptoms, also referred to as an exacerbation. A flare-up can come on suddenly and cause a worsening of your COPD symptoms such as:

title: Gallstones
definition: Hard, pebble-like deposits that form inside the gallbladder.

title: Gastric Banding
definition: Surgical insertion of a medical device that is placed around the top of the stomach to help manage weight, in order to treat obesity.

title: Gastric Bypass
definition: Surgery that helps a person lose weight and treat obesity by changing how the stomach and small intestine handle food.

title: Gastroparesis
definition: Gastroparesis is also known as delayed gastric emptying or delayed stomach emptying. It is a condition in which the muscles in your stomach don’t function normally, interfering with digestion.

title: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
definition: Persistent (at least 6 months) and excessive feelings of worry, dread, uneasiness, or fear that are strong enough to interfere with one's daily activities. People with GAD find it difficult to control their anxiety and typically worry about many different things, such as money, health, family, work, or other issues, and may expect the worst even when there is no apparent reason for concern.

title: GERD
definition: Gastroesophageal reflux disease, often called GERD or acid reflux, is a condition in which the stomach contents (food or liquid) leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus (the tube from the mouth to the stomach). This can irritate the esophagus, causing heartburn and other symptoms.

title: Glaucoma
definition: Glaucoma refers to a group of eye conditions that can cause damage to the optic nerve, and impair vision.

title: Gout
definition: A condition in which crystals of uric acid are deposited in the joints, resulting in pain, burning, and swelling.

title: Gout Flare
definition: A gout flare is an attack of pain, swelling, and tenderness in the joints. Gout flares can occur suddenly. Most often they happen in a big toe. Gout flares can also affect feet, elbows, knees, and ankles.

title: Hardening of the Arteries
definition: Hardening of the arteries happens when the blood vessels that carry oxygen and nutrients from your heart to the rest of your body become thick and stiff. It is caused by a build-up of cholesterol inside your blood vessels. Hardening of the arteries is also called atherosclerosis.

title: HDL cholesterol
definition: High-density lipoprotein, or HDL, is known as "good" cholesterol because it absorbs excess cholesterol in the bloodstream and reduces the risk for heart disease and stroke.

title: Heart attack
definition: When blood vessels that supply blood to the heart become blocked, preventing enough oxygen from getting to the heart. The heart muscle dies or becomes permanently damaged. Your doctor calls this a myocardial infarction.

title: Heart Disease (Cardiovascular Disease)
definition: A class of diseases that involve the heart, blood vessels, or both; includes heart attack, stroke, TIA, and others.

title: Heart Valve
definition: The heart has four chambers and four valves. The heart valves make sure that blood always flows freely in a forward direction and that there is no backward leakage.

title: Hemochromatosis
definition: Iron overload, or too much iron in the body.

title: Hemosiderosis
definition: A form of iron overload in which iron is deposited in tissues throughout the body.

title: Hepatitis (hep·a·ti·tis)
definition: A swelling of the liver that makes it stop working well. Sometimes hepatitis can be caused by hepatitis B or C viruses that are spread through exposure to infected blood or bodily fluid.

title: Hepatitis B and C
definition: Hepatitis B and C are viruses that are spread through exposure to infected blood or bodily fluids, which can cause inflammation and damage to the liver.

title: Hepatitis B
definition: A virus that attacks the liver, spread through exposure to the blood or other body fluids of an infected person. Infection can be prevented by a vaccine.

title: Hepatitis C
definition: A virus that attacks the liver, spread through exposure to the blood of an infected person. There is currently no vaccine to prevent infection, but there are available antiviral medicines.

title: High cholesterol or hypercholesterolemia
definition: Cholesterol is a fatty substance that the body needs to function normally. High levels of cholesterol in the blood, caused by diet or family history, can lead to plaque buildup in the blood vessels.

title: High Triglycerides or hypertriglyceridemia
definition: High amount of a type of fat in your body; raises risk of heart disease and may be a sign of metabolic syndrome.

title: HIV (AIDS)
definition: HIV is a viral infection that gradually destroys the immune system. It is passed from person to person through bodily fluids.

title: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy
definition: During this treatment the patient inhales 100% oxygen in a pressurized chamber. This can help heal foot ulcers by increasing oxygen levels in the blood.

title: Hyperglycemia (High blood sugar)
definition: When a large amount of glucose is in the blood plasma.

title: Hyperlipidemia
definition: Hyperlipidemia is a high level of fats in the blood. These fats, called lipids, include cholesterol and triglycerides.

title: Hypersomnia
definition: Excessive daytime sleepiness, where a person has trouble staying awake during the day. People with hypersomnia can fall asleep at any time; for instance, at work or while they are driving.

title: Hypertension (hi·per·ten·shun)
definition: A condition where blood flows through the blood vessels with a force greater than normal, pushing against the walls of your arteries. Hypertension or high blood pressure can strain the heart, damage blood vessels, and increase the risk for cardiovascular disease.

title: Hypogonadism
definition: Hypogonadism is a condition where the body’s sex glands produce little or no sex hormones. It is more prevalent in males and is often referred to as low testosterone.

title: Ileostomy
definition: A surgical procedure that connects the ileum (the lowest part of the small intestine) to the surface of the abdomen, creating an opening called a stoma. Waste material leaves the body through the stoma and collects in an ileostomy bag.

title: Indeterminate Colitis
definition: Inflammation of the bowel that has features of both ulcerative colitis and Crohn’s disease.

title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
definition: Inflammatory bowel disease, or IBD, includes Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis, and causes inflammation in the digestive tract. The causes of IBD are unknown. Inflammatory bowel disease symptoms include abdominal cramps, bloody diarrhea, fever, and even weight loss.

title: Insomnia
definition: Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep.

title: Inspire
definition: A surgically implanted device for the treatment of sleep apnea. It monitors your breathing while you sleep, and stimulates muscles in your airway to help keep it open.

title: Insulin
definition: Hormone produced in the body (and can be taken as medication) that regulates carbohydrate and fat metabolism, and guides glucose use by the body.

title: Intermittent claudication (in·ter·mit·ent clau·dih·kay·shun)
definition: Pain from reduced or stopped blood flow, usually to the legs, causing them to hurt or feel numb.

title: Interstitial lung disease (in-tur-STISH-ul)
definition: A large group of disorders, most of which cause progressive scarring of lung tissue.

title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
definition: An intestinal disorder causing abdominal pain, discomfort, bloating, and alteration of bowel habits. Diarrhea or constipation may predominate, or they may alternate.

title: Isolated Colonic Crohn’s Disease or Crohn’s colitis
definition: Crohn’s disease is an inflammation of the digestive system that can affect any area from the mouth to the anus. In Isolated Colonic Crohn’s disease or Crohn’s colitis, only the colon, also known as the large intestine, is affected.

title: Kidney Disease
definition: Kidney disease is any one of several chronic conditions that are caused by damage to the cells of the kidney.

title: Kidney transplant
definition: An organ transplant of a healthy kidney into a patient with kidney disease.

title: Laparoscopy
definition: A surgical procedure in which a scope is inserted through a small cut in the abdomen.

title: Laparotomy
definition: A surgical procedure in which a large cut is made into the abdomen.

title: LDL cholesterol
definition: Low-density lipoprotein, or LDL, is known as "bad" cholesterol because it can build up in the walls of the blood vessels and form plaques. These plaques can restrict the flow of blood through the blood vessels and increase the risk for heart attack and stroke.

title: Leukemia
definition: Leukemia is cancer of the body's blood-forming tissues, including bone marrow, and usually involves the white blood cells. There are many types of leukemia, such as acute lymphoblastic leukemia, acute myeloid leukemia, and chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

title: Liver Disease
definition: Liver disease is any disturbance of liver function that causes illness. Symptoms of liver diseases include weakness and fatigue, weight loss, nausea, vomiting, and yellow discoloration of the skin (jaundice).

title: Low testosterone
definition: Testosterone is the male sex hormone. It's natural for testosterone levels to decline as men age, but sometimes abnormally low testosterone can cause symptoms such as low sex drive, decreased bone mass, loss of muscle size and strength, fatigue, and depression.

title: Lung Fibrosis
definition: Formation of excessive connective tissue in the lungs, commonly referred to as "scarring of the lungs."

title: Lupus
definition: A long-term autoimmune disease where the body's immune system becomes hyperactive and attacks normal, healthy tissue. This results in symptoms such as inflammation, swelling, and damage to joints, skin, kidneys, blood, the heart, and lungs.

title: Lymphoma
definition: Lymphoma is cancer of the lymphatic system, which is the body's disease-fighting network. The main types are Hodgkin's lymphoma and non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

title: Major depressive disorder (MDD)
definition:
A mood disorder that causes symptoms such as:
Feeling hopeless, negative, helpless, or sad
Difficulty sleeping or sleeping more than usual
Changes in appetite
Withdrawing from social interaction
Losing interest in things you usually find enjoyable, such as hobbies
Loss of energy
Difficulty concentrating
Typically a person with depression will have more than one of these symptoms. Depression can be triggered by a chemical imbalance or stressful, emotional situations.

title: Male pattern balding
definition: The most common type of hair loss in men. It usually follows a pattern of receding hairline and hair thinning on the crown, and is caused by hormones and genetic predisposition.

title: Manometry
definition: Measures the pressure and electrical activity of muscle groups.

title: Metabolic syndrome
definition: A cluster of conditions -- increased blood pressure, a high blood sugar level, excess body fat around the waist, and abnormal cholesterol levels -- that occur together, increasing your risk of heart disease, stroke and diabetes.

title: Migraine Headache
definition: An intense headache that can last for hours to days, and typically causes pulsing or throbbing pain, accompanied by other symptoms like nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light and sound.

title: Mild cognitive impairment
definition: An intermediate stage between the normal decline of brain function that occurs with aging, and the more serious decline that occurs with dementia. It can cause problems with memory, language, thinking, and judgment.

title: Mini-Stroke, also called TIA
definition: A transient ischemic attack, also called a TIA or mini-stroke, is when blood flow to a part of the brain stops for a brief period of time, causing stroke-like symptoms for 1 - 2 hours.

title: Multiple sclerosis
definition: A nervous system disease that affects the brain and spinal cord. The body's immune system eats away at the protective sheath (myelin) that covers the nerves. This damage makes it hard for the brain, spinal cord, and other areas of the body to communicate.

title: Narcolepsy
definition: A disorder that affects the control of sleep and wakefulness. It causes excessive sleepiness and sleep attacks at inappropriate times.

title: NASH (Non-alcoholic steatohepatitis)
definition: A condition which causes liver cell injury and inflammation, in addition to fat build-up in the liver, in people who drink little or no alcohol.

title: NAFLD (Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease)
definition: A condition in which fat builds up in the liver, in people who drink little or no alcohol.

title: Non-menstrual pelvic pain
definition: Pelvic pain experienced at times of the month other than during the menstrual period.

title: Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
definition: A disorder that causes unreasonable thoughts and fears (obsessions), that lead to repetitive behaviors (compulsions). Common compulsions include hand washing, counting things, and checking to see if a door is locked, and occur to such a degree that the person's daily life is negatively affected.

title: Osteoarthritis
definition: A form of arthritis, occurring mainly in older persons, that is characterized by chronic degeneration (wear and tear) of the cartilage of the joints. Also called degenerative joint disease.

title: Osteoporosis
definition: Thinning of bones that can cause them to break or fracture easily.

title: Ovarian cyst
definition: A solid or fluid-filled sac or pocket within or on the surface of an ovary. Most ovarian cysts don't cause symptoms. In some cases, menstrual irregularities, pain during intercourse, or irregular bowel movements can occur. Many cysts go away on their own. If not, treatments are birth control pills or surgery.

title: Overactive bladder
definition: A problem with bladder function that causes a sudden urge to urinate. The urge may be difficult to control, and may lead to the involuntary loss of urine (incontinence).

title: Pacemaker
definition: A small device that is placed in the chest or abdomen to help control abnormal heart rhythms.

title: Panic disorder
definition: An anxiety disorder that causes recurrent, unexpected panic attacks. Panic attacks are sudden periods of intense fear that may include heart palpitations, sweating, shaking, shortness of breath, numbness, or a feeling that something bad is going to happen.

title: Pancreatitis
definition: Swelling and inflammation of the pancreas; may be acute (develops suddenly) or chronic (persists or worsens over time and may lead to permanent damage).

title: Acute pancreatitis
definition: Sudden swelling and inflammation of the pancreas.

title: Chronic pancreatitis
definition: Inflammation of the pancreas that does not heal or improve, gets worse over time, and leads to permanent damage.

title: Parkinson’s disease
definition: Parkinson’s disease is a slowly progressive neurologic disease characterized by a fixed, inexpressive face, a tremor at rest, slowing of voluntary movements, a gait with short accelerating steps, peculiar posture, and muscle weakness. It is caused by degeneration of an area of the brain.

title: Peptic or Gastric Ulcer
definition: A peptic ulcer is a defect in the protective lining of the stomach or the first part of the small intestine. When this lining breaks down, it results in inflammation (gastritis) or an ulcer. A peptic ulcer in the stomach is called a gastric ulcer.

title: Percutaneous Coronary Intervention or PCI
definition: Heart procedures, such as stent placement or angioplasty, performed using a catheter which is inserted through the groin or wrist.

title: Periodic limb movement disorder
definition: An involuntary repetitive cramping or jerking of the legs during sleep.

title: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD)
definition: Narrowing of the blood vessels outside of your heart. This happens when plaque, a substance made up of fat and cholesterol, builds up on the wall of the arteries that supply blood to the arms and legs. The plaque causes the arteries to narrow or become blocked.

title: Peripheral Vascular Disease
definition: Peripheral vascular disease (PVD) refers to diseases and disorders of the blood vessels outside of the heart, such as those of the brain, gut, kidneys, or limbs. PVD is typically caused by blockage or damage to blood vessels such as veins and arteries.

title: Pervasive developmental disorder
definition: One of several developmental disorders that delay the development of socialization and communication. Children or adults with PDD have some but not all characteristics of autism, or have relatively mild symptoms.

title: Phototherapy
definition: Phototherapy, or light therapy, involves exposing the skin to ultraviolet (UV) light on a regular basis and under medical supervision. Treatments are done in a doctor's office or psoriasis clinic or at home with a phototherapy unit. Some people use natural sunlight or tanning beds. The key to success with light therapy is consistency.

title: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
definition: A hormone imbalance that can cause ovarian cysts. Common symptoms include irregular or infrequent periods, extra hair on the face or other parts of the body, acne, weight gain, or difficulty losing weight.

title: Post-Nasal Drip (Upper Airway Cough Syndrome)
definition: When extra mucus runs down the back of your nose to your throat. Postnasal drip makes you feel like you constantly want to clear your throat.

title: Post-traumatic Stress Disorder
definition: Post-traumatic Stress Disorder, or PTSD, is an anxiety disorder caused by exposure to traumatic events, such as war, sexual abuse, or a severe accident. People with PTSD often experience "flashbacks," nightmares, difficulty experiencing emotions, or difficulty remembering aspects of the traumatic event.

title: Prader-Willi Syndrome
definition: A rare genetic disorder that causes physical, mental and behavioral problems. A key feature is a constant sense of hunger that usually begins at about 2 years of age. People with Prader-Willi Syndrome want to eat constantly because they never feel full (hyperphagia), and usually have trouble controlling their weight.

title: Pre-diabetes
definition: Pre-diabetes is an unhealthy body state that comes before diabetes, in which blood sugar is elevated and the body is not using insulin properly. People with pre-diabetes may also suffer from symptoms of fully developed diabetes.

title: Premature ovarian failure
definition: Loss of normal function of the ovaries before age 40. Also called early menopause.

title: Primary sclerosing cholangitis or primary biliary cirrhosis
definition: Diseases of the bile ducts, which are tubes that carry a digestive liquid called bile from your liver and gallbladder to your small intestine. They are two different conditions, but both may ultimately cause cirrhosis and liver failure.

title: Protein or albumin in your urine
definition: Also known as microalbuminuria; occurs when the kidney leaks small amounts of albumin into the urine.

title: Psoriasis
definition: Psoriasis is a common skin condition that causes skin redness and irritation. Most people with psoriasis have thick, red skin with flaky, silver-white patches called scales.

title: Psoriatic arthritis
definition: A disease causing both skin and joint inflammation. Symptoms include pain, stiffness and swelling.

title: Psychosis
definition: A mental disorder characterized by a disconnection from reality. Possible symptoms include delusions, hallucinations, talking incoherently, and agitation. The person with the condition usually isn't aware of his or her behavior. Psychosis may occur as a result of a psychiatric illness like schizophrenia. In other instances, it may be caused by a health condition, medications, or drug use.

title: Pulmonary (lung) fibrosis
definition: A condition in which the tissue deep in your lungs becomes scarred over time. This tissue gets thick and stiff, making it hard for you to catch your breath.

title: Pulmonary Hypertension (pul·mo·nary hi·per·ten·shun)
definition: High blood pressure in the arteries of the lungs.

title: PUVA
definition: PUVA stands for psoralen (P) and ultraviolet A (UVA) therapy. First, a patient is exposed to drugs called psoralens which make the skin more reactive to ultraviolet light. Then the patient is exposed to UVA light.

title: Q-tip test
definition: A Q-Tip (cotton swab) lubricated with anesthetic gel is inserted into the urethra (the opening to the bladder). You are then asked to cough and strain, and the doctor observes how the Q-tip reacts. Too much movement of the Q-Tip may indicate weak pelvic floor and urethral connective tissue, which may place a woman at risk for urinary incontinence.

title: Reactive Arthritis (Reiter Syndrome)
definition: Joint pain and swelling triggered by an infection in another part of your body, most often your intestines, genitals, or urinary tract. Also called Reiter’s syndrome.

title: Renal insufficiency
definition: A condition in which the kidneys lose the ability to remove waste and balance fluids.

title: Respiratory Tract Infection
definition: Any infection of the sinuses, throat, airways or lungs. Sometimes an antibiotic is prescribed. Common respiratory tract infections include the common cold, a sinus infection, laryngitis, the flu, bronchitis, and pneumonia.

title: Restless legs syndrome (RLS)
definition: A disorder in which there is an urge or need to move the legs to stop unpleasant sensations.

title: Retinopathy
definition: Persistent or sudden damage to the retina of the eye, with inflammation and changes to the blood vessels, typically associated with diabetes or high blood pressure.

title: Revascularization
definition: A blood vessel graft to restore blood flow.

title: Rheumatoid Arthritis
definition: Rheumatoid arthritis is a form of arthritis in which the membranes or tissues lining the joints become inflamed. Joint inflammation causes swelling and pain, which over time may destroy the joint tissues and lead to disability.

title: Rosacea
definition: A skin condition that causes redness and visible blood vessels on the central part of the face. It may also produce small, red, pus-filled bumps, and can cause burning or irritation of the eyes. These symptoms may flare up and then die down for a while.

title: Sarcoidosis
definition: A disease in which inflammation occurs in the lymph nodes, lungs, liver, eyes, skin, or other tissues.

title: Sarcopenia
definition: Sarcopenia is the progressive loss of muscle mass and strength that occurs as part of the aging process. While it is normal to lose some muscle as people get older, people with sarcopenia have difficulty performing everyday activities and often experience loss of strength, frailty, falls, and difficulty moving around (such as walking, climbing stairs, or getting up from a chair).

title: Schizophrenia
definition: Schizophrenia is a complex, severe, and disabling brain disorder that makes it hard to:
subDefinition: Treatments include antipsychotic medications and various psychosocial treatments.

title: Seizure Disorders (Such as Epilepsy)
definition: Epilepsy is a brain disorder involving repeated, spontaneous seizures of any type. Seizures are episodes of disturbed brain function that cause changes in attention or behavior.

title: Shingles or Herpes Zoster Virus
definition: Shingles is a viral infection that causes a painful rash. Although shingles can occur anywhere on your body, it most often appears as a single stripe of blisters that wraps around either the left or the right side of your torso. Shingles is caused by the varicella-zoster virus -- the same virus that causes chickenpox.

title: Sickle cell disease
definition: A group of inherited red blood cell disorders. The red blood cells become hard and sticky and look like a C-shaped farm tool called a "sickle." The sickle cells die early, which causes a constant shortage of red blood cells. Also, when they travel through small blood vessels, they get stuck and clog the blood flow. This can cause pain and other serious problems such as infection and stroke.

title: Skin cancer
definition: Abnormal growth of skin cells, usually developing on areas that are exposed to the sun. The three major types of skin cancer are basal cell carcinoma, squamous cell carcinoma, and melanoma.

title: Skin graft
definition: A skin graft is a patch of skin that is removed by surgery from one area of the body and transplanted, or attached, to another area.

title: Sleep Apnea
definition: Breathing issues while sleeping. It causes abnormal pauses in breathing or periods of abnormally low breathing during sleep.

title: Sleep terror
definition: An episode of screaming or intense fear while still asleep.

title: Sleepwalking disorder
definition: A condition that causes people to get up and walk while they are asleep.

title: Spinal fracture
definition: A broken bone in the spine.

title: Stenosis
definition: A narrowing of a blood vessel or artery.

title: Stent Placement
definition: The insertion of a tube that holds open a blood vessel/artery.

title: Steroids
definition: Steroids are medications that reduce inflammation. Steroids can be given by mouth, by injection, or rectally. They are frequently given short-term to treat a flare-up of certain diseases, but can be used on a regular basis to help control chronic diseases. Commonly used steroids include prednisone, prednisolone, dexamethasone, methylprednisolone, and Medrol.

title: Stress Test
definition: A test used by doctors to gather information about the health of your heart. The most common type is an exercise stress test, in which you may be asked to exercise on a treadmill or stationary bicycle while your heart is monitored.

title: Stroke
definition: A stroke happens when blood flow to a part of the brain stops. A stroke is sometimes called a "brain attack." Symptoms usually develop suddenly and without warning. Clot-busting drugs (thrombolytic therapy) may be used if the stroke is caused by a blood clot.

title: Temporomandibular Joint Disorders or TMF or TMJ
definition: Cause pain in the jaw joint and in the muscles that control jaw movement.

title: Tension headache
definition: The most common type of headache among adults, causing mild to moderate pain; also called a stress headache. Some people describe a tension headache as feeling like a tight band around their forehead.

title: Thalassemia
definition: An inherited blood disorder where the body doesn’t make enough hemoglobin, a protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen.

title: Tic Disorder
definition: A tic disorder is a disorder in which people have quick, uncontrollable movements, or vocal outbursts.

title: Tourette’s Disorder or Tourette’s Syndrome
definition: A condition that causes people to make repetitive movements or noises, called tics, such as repeatedly clearing their throat, facial twitches, or (rarely) uncontrollably using offensive language.

title: Trigeminal Neuralgia
definition: A nerve disorder that causes a stabbing or electric-shock-like pain in parts of the face.

title: Type 1 Diabetes
definition: Type 1 diabetes is usually diagnosed in children and young adults. In type 1 diabetes, the body does not produce insulin. People with type 1 diabetes must take insulin as treatment.

title: Type 2 Diabetes
definition: In type 2 diabetes, the pancreas produces insulin but the body is unable to use it effectively because the cells are resistant to the action of insulin. People with type 2 diabetes may treat the disease with diet and exercise and/or medication.

title: Tuberculosis (TB)
definition: A contagious bacterial infection that involves the lungs. The disease is spread when an infected person coughs or sneezes. People with TB may experience coughing, fever, night sweats, weight loss, and may cough up blood. TB usually attacks the lungs, but may also spread to other organs.

title: Ulcerative colitis (ul·cer·a·tive co·li·tis)
definition: A disease that causes ulcers in the lining of the rectum and colon.

title: Ulcerative Proctitis
definition: A disease that causes ulcers in the lining of the rectum, which is the last six inches of the large intestine.

title: Urethral bulking
definition: Material such as collagen or a water-based gel is injected around the urethra (the opening to the bladder). This narrows the urethra so leakage of urine is less likely to occur.

title: Urinary incontinence
definition: Involuntary leakage of urine, meaning that a person urinates when they do not mean to.

title: Uterine fibroids
definition: Noncancerous (benign) growths in the uterus that can develop during a woman's childbearing years. Most women with uterine fibroids have no symptoms, while others may have painful or heavy periods, frequent urination, pain during sex, or low back pain.

title: Uterine polyps
definition: Growths attached to the inner wall of the uterus that extend into the uterine cavity. They are usually noncancerous (benign), although some can be cancerous or eventually turn into cancer. You can have one or many uterine polyps. They most commonly occur in women who are going through or have completed menopause, although younger women can get them, too.

title: UVA and UVB
definition: Wavelengths of ultraviolet (UV) light that are important for phototherapy.

title: Uveitis
definition: Inflammation of the middle layer of the eye, called the uvea. Symptoms may include eye redness, pain, sensitivity to light, blurred vision, or dark floating spots in your field of vision.

title: Vaginal atrophy
definition: Thinning, drying, and inflammation of the vaginal walls due to low levels of the hormone estrogen. Vaginal atrophy occurs most often after menopause, and may cause symptoms like vaginal dryness or itching, pain during sexual intercourse, and urinary problems.

title: Vaginal rejuvenation or MonaLisa Touch
definition: A non-invasive laser treatment for vaginal atrophy, which often occurs after menopause and may cause symptoms like vaginal dryness or itching, and pain during sexual intercourse. This treatment may also help with urinary leakage.

title: Vaginismus
definition: A condition in which the vaginal muscles squeeze or spasm when something is entering the vagina. Patients with vaginismus may experience pain or discomfort during sex or pelvic exams, or when trying to insert a tampon.

title: Wilson's disease
definition: An inherited disorder that causes too much copper to build up in the body, particularly in the liver, brain, and eyes.

title: Winx
definition: A breathing machine for sleep apnea. Unlike CPAP, Winx does not have a mask - it is composed of a flexible mouthpiece connected to a console that applies a negative pressure inside the mouth to prevent the airway from collapsing.

title: What is an online screening questionnaire?
definition: The online screening questionnaire asks a series of relevant health-related questions and compares the responses to the enrollment criteria for this clinical study to help determine your eligibility to participate in a specific study.

title: What should I do if I have a question about the online screening questionnaire?
definition: If you are unsure about a particular question or do not understand what you are being asked, please select the appropriate help topic link. The Help and Synopsis buttons will always be available if you have questions or concerns while completing the questionnaire. We encourage you to discuss any detailed medical questions with your physician or other healthcare provider. You may also contact us by email or call the toll-free number, which was provided in the message that you received, to complete the screening questionnaire by telephone. Our call center operators are available 24 hours a day.

title: How long will it take to complete the online screening questionnaire?
definition: The length of time required to complete the online screening questionnaire will vary from person to person and may also vary depending on the speed of your Internet connection or browser. For your convenience a progress bar located at the bottom of the page indicates your relative position within the survey, which can be used as an indicator of the length of time remaining until the questionnaire will be complete.

title: How do I navigate around the online screening questionnaire?
definition:
While completing the online screening questionnaire, please always use the Next and Back buttons provided at the bottom of the screen to move forward and backward through the questionnaire. Please DO NOT use your Internet browser's FORWARD and BACK buttons.
After completing a question, select the Next button to move to the next question; select the Back button to move to a previous question.
The Help and Synopsis buttons will always be available if you have questions or concerns while completing the questionnaire.

title: How do I change a response to a specific question?
definition:
If you would like to revise a response, select the back button to navigate to that question and revise as necessary.
Please note, however, that the series of questions may change based on any revisions you make to your responses. Therefore, if you revise any response, you will need to recheck your responses for the subsequent questions.

title: How will I know if I am eligible to participate in a clinical study?
definition: If your responses establish that you passed the initial screening for this clinical study, you will be asked to select from a list of convenient locations. Your completed questionnaire will then be forwarded to the study location that you choose, and a member of the clinical study staff there will contact you to schedule an appointment.

title: Once I complete the online screening questionnaire, how do I get back onto the Internet?
definition: Once you have clicked on the Submit button and have reached our "Thank you" page, you can follow the link on that page to the Acurian Web site, or you can simply use one of your bookmarks or type in a URL to go to another site on the Internet.

title: What if I have questions or concerns that are not answered here or elsewhere in the Help section?
definition: We encourage you to discuss any detailed medical questions with your physician or other healthcare provider. You may also contact us by email if you have questions about completing the online screening questionnaire.

title: How do I address any technical problems I encounter while completing an online screening questionnaire?
definition:
Unfortunately, we occasionally experience technical problems with our servers or online screening questionnaires. From time to time, our servers may become overloaded when too many people try to access a questionnaire at the same time. If you can't access the questionnaire or it takes too long to complete a particular survey, you can always complete the questionnaire at a later time.
If you are experiencing a technical problem, please feel free to contact us by email or call the toll-free number, which was provided in the message that you received, to complete the screening questionnaire by telephone. Our call center operators are available 24 hours a day.

title: Which browser works best?
definition:
We recommend using Internet Explorer 7.0 (or subsequent releases) to view our online screening questionnaires. We also encourage AOL users to use the non-AOL version of Internet Explorer when completing our questionnaires because it produces a faster connection and a better overall experience. For your convenience, here is a link to the download of the latest version of Internet Explorer:
Internet Explorer

title: What other computer technology do I need to complete the online screening questionnaire?
definition: All you need is an Internet browser (please see Which browser works best?) and an Internet connection to complete the online screening questionnaire.

title: What is a clinical study?
definition: A clinical study involves volunteers and is conducted by qualified physicians to evaluate the use of an investigational medication or medical device for a specific disease or group of diseases.

title: What are the risks and benefits of participating in a clinical study?
definition:
Most eligible volunteers enroll in a clinical study because they hope that they will personally benefit from the study-related treatment they receive, or because they want to help advance medical science, believing they can help other individuals who may some day benefit from what is learned in the study. However, there may be no benefits promised if you elect to participate. The study doctor will discuss the potential risks and benefits with you.
You will be presented with an Informed Consent form that every study participant must understand and sign before enrolling into the clinical study. The Informed Consent lists — in detail — the most common known risks and side effects of the proposed treatment.

title: Should I still see my family doctor?
definition: Yes. Participants should see their family doctor for routine medical care.

title: Will my family doctor be kept informed of my progress and test results?
definition: We encourage you to talk with the clinical study doctor about how he/she will involve and/or inform your personal physician. This will only be done with your permission.

title: How will the information that is collected be used?
definition:
Your responses to the screening questions will be compared to the enrollment criteria for this clinical study to help determine your eligibility to participate in the study.
Your responses remain confidential and will not be shared with anyone for any purpose other than determining your eligibility for this study. For more information please read our privacy policy.

title: Why do we need your personal information and contact information?
definition:
We need to ensure that we are able to provide the most up-to-date personal information and contact information available to the study site that you choose if your responses establish your eligibility to participate in this clinical study. The study site will need to contact you as quickly as possible to schedule an appointment and will also need to provide any special instructions that might be necessary or helpful for that appointment and any subsequent office visits.
Remember: Acurian will never reveal your personal information or contact information to anyone else for any purpose other than this study without your explicit permission (see our privacy policy).

title: Does anyone have access to my personal information?
definition: Protecting your privacy is important to us. We employ sophisticated technology to protect your personal information, and we will not release your information without your permission. For more detailed information, please review our privacy policy.

title: What is Acurian?
definition: Acurian is a company that helps potential clinical study volunteers and caregivers find doctors who are conducting clinical studies. In this way, Acurian helps to speed up the study process for new investigational medicines. For more information about Acurian and clinical studies, visit their web site at www.acurian.com.

title: Contact information
definition: If you have comments, suggestions, or concerns about the online screening questionnaire, please feel free to contact us.

title: What if I have a specific medical question?
definition: We encourage you to discuss any specific medical questions with your physician or other healthcare provider. Your doctor or other healthcare professional is the best source of information to answer your questions.

title: Why did I disqualify?
definition: I'm sorry but I am unable to give you the specific reason why you did not pass the initial screening for this clinical study. Whether a person prequalified or not is based on more than just having, or being diagnosed with the condition. Each study is unique and many factors are taken into consideration to determine a person’s eligibility based on certain criteria, such as medications that are being taken, the degree of symptoms experienced, overall health condition and history, just to name a few. All responses to your questions are entered into a computer program and based on the clinical study’s criteria, individuals will qualify or disqualify. This system is designed to protect the privacy of potential participants which is why I do not have access to know why you did not qualify.

title: Call center only: Why are you calling me, I am on your do-not-call list?
definition: I truly appreciate your concern. Acurian is a research company, and we’re calling to inform you of a clinical research opportunity that we thought might be of interest to you. We’re not in any way trying to sell you a product or service. If you’d like to discontinue receiving these calls we can add you to our own do not call list. When a person requests to be placed on the do not call list, it can take up to 10 days for the request to be processed. All information provided at the time of this request should be an exact match to insure the removal of your information from future calls is complete. If you have multiple phone numbers, such as a home phone and cell phone, please be sure to provide all numbers.
